newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe shares weaker in post-Easter slumber.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe shares weaker in post-Easter slumber.

text.p: Zimbabwean shares traded generally weaker as trade resumed on a fairly subdued note after the Easter holiday, brokers said.
"The market was asleep mostly I think because of the new issues. People are still watching to see the results of Randalls (whose share offer closed recently)," one broker said.
On Tuesday, the main industrial index dropped 62.94 points to close at 10,107.03.

Investors Chemco shed 200 cents to 4,500, newspaper group Zimpapers were 100 cents weaker at 4,800 while bankers FMB and Barclays each lost 50 cents to 4,450 and 3,400 respectively. Blue chip conglomerate Delta eased 25 cents to 1,700.
Minings were also dull with Falcon trading unchanged in small volumes while another gold producer, Falgold shed five cents to 65. The seven-counter secondary index there lost 2.51 points to 987.72.
